title: Curry calls injury a 'gut punch,' won't rush return
content: Calling the situation "a gut punch," Stephen Curry said he knows he has to be careful and can't rush his return given the "tricky" nature of hamstring injuries.

title: Report: Pacers' Haliburton warned for G2 dance
content: Tyrese Haliburton received a warning, not a fine, for his celebration after the Pacers' Game 2 win at Cleveland in the East semifinals Tuesday, according to a person with knowledge of the matter.

title: Tatum shouldering blame: 'I need to be better'
content: Celtics star Jayson Tatum shouldered the blame for his struggles over the first two games of the team's playoff series with the New York Knicks and vowed improvement.

title: Texans rookie Higgins makes history with deal
content: Texans rookie wide receiver Jayden Higgins has become the first second-round pick in NFL history to receive a fully guaranteed contract.

title: Sources: Pacquiao to end retirement for title shot
content: Boxing star Manny Pacquiao, who retired nearly four years ago, will return to the ring in July to face Mario Barrios for his WBC welterweight title, sources confirmed to ESPN.

title: Brandon Miller testifies he was nearly shot in '23
content: Brandon Miller testified Thursday that he was almost struck by bullets fired into his car during the January 2023 shooting that killed Jamea Harris near The Strip in Tuscaloosa.

title: Lemon, WS champ and 3-time All-Star, dies at 70
content: Chet Lemon, a three-time All Star and World Series champion with the 1984 Detroit Tigers, has died at the age of 70.

title: ðŸŽµ King of TikTok: 'LeBron James' song trend
content: Professional athletes have long been name-dropped in hip-hop songs, but R&B songs comprised solely of LeBron and Curry's names? That's a more recent phenomenon.

title: Top prospects for the 2025 NHL draft: Updated rankings after U18s, draft lottery
content: There's a consensus on the top four -- after that, all bets are off. Who will your team select in June?

title: Five surprising MLB performances -- and why they're happening
content: We break down a breakout bat, a prospect finally coming into his own, a power hitter who has stopped hitting home runs, and more.

title: Power Rankings: Tigers make top-5 debut as Mariners, Royals are on the rise
content: While NL powerhouses duke it out at the top, a new club is leading the way in the AL, with two others also on the up.

title: The biggest remaining roster hole for every NFL team: Where all 32 could still upgrade
content: Teams have added to their rosters through free agency, trades and the draft, but they all have at least one position that still needs a boost.

title: NFL experts debate the draft: Which midround picks could be fantasy sleepers?
content: A dozen experts weigh in on the draft with their top picks, Rookie of the Year predictions and fantasy sleepers.

title: What should we expect from Shedeur Sanders in Cleveland?
content: Fifth-round draft picks don't typically carry the weight of expectations. Ahead of his first NFL practice, what's realistic for Sanders in a Browns uniform?

title: At long last, Michigan State aligns with Larry Nassar survivors
content: Nassar survivors and MSU president Kevin Guskiewicz announced a new assessment of the school's culture.

title: Post-spring Way-Too-Early Top 25: Where do Texas and Notre Dame rank?
content: Where do the top teams stand after spring practice and roster movement from the transfer portal? Mark Schlabach updates the rankings.

title: GM is the new gold rush for college football
content: The general manager position is exploding in college football as more and more NFL personnel get involved.

title: Projecting how good the expansion Valkyries will be in their inaugural WNBA season
content: Historically, WNBA expansion teams have struggled in their first season. How many games might Golden State win in 2025?

title: One game from glory, Postecoglou is doing it the "anti-Spursy" way
content: Ange Postecoglou's Tottenham side have had a rollercoaster of a Europa League, but can they finally win their first major trophy in 17 years?

title: Champions League final: Inter or PSG? Our experts make their picks
content: ESPN writers gaze into their crystal balls to predict who will be crowned European champions at Munich's Allianz Arena on May 31, Inter or PSG.

title: Beckham, Neville complete Salford City takeover
content: Salford City have been acquired by a new ownership group led by former England internationals David Beckham and Gary Neville, who were already investors in the club.

title: Man United great Evra's MMA debut postponed
content: Former France and Manchester United player Patrice Evra's mixed martial arts debut has been postponed.

title: Kerr, Mewis announce birth of their first child
content: United States women's national team midfielder Kristie Mewis and her partner, Chelsea striker Sam Kerr, have announced the birth of their first child.

title: PSG keeper credits Mother Nature for UCL heroics
content: Gianluigi Donnarumma's thanked Mother Nature for his heroics against Arsenal as Paris Saint-Germain booked their ticket for the UCL final in Munich

title: Haaland blames lack of 'hunger' for poor season
content: Erling Haaland has said there are no excuses for Man City's season and said it has happened because he and his teammates "haven't been good enough."

title: 3 hospitalized, 43 arrested as PSG reach UCL final
content: One person was in critical condition and two others also hospitalised after being hit by a car amid street partying by Paris Saint-Germain fans.

title: PSG boss relieved to avoid ex-club in UCL final
content: Paris Saint-Germain coach Luis Enrique is relieved to be facing Inter Milan and not former club Barcelona in the Champions League final on May 31.

title: Setting records and continuing a legacy: CJ Kirst is carrying on his family name
content: CJ Kirst is just the latest Kirst to make a name for himself and is leading Cornell into the NCAA tournament.

title: Betting buzz: Bettors sticking with Celtics despite Knicks' 2-0 lead
content: Despite dropping the first two games, bettors are still picking the Boston Celtics in their series against the New York Knicks.

title: Stanley Cup playoff odds: Rantanen new Conn Smythe fave after hat trick
content: Every playoff team's odds to win the 2025 Stanley Cup and favorites for the Conn Smythe Trophy for playoff MVP.

title: How NASCAR drivers keep their cool in 140-degree cockpits
content: NASCAR cockpits can reach 140 degrees, so how do drivers keep cool? The answer is liquid-cooled clothing.

title: Pound-for-pound rankings: Inoue retains spot, Canelo falls after lackluster performance
content: Where do Naoya Inoue and Canelo Alvarez land after winning their fights this past weekend? Here are the latest ESPN P4P rankings.

title: Raleigh in fantasy's top 25? Webb destined for Cy Young? Don't be surprised
content: Eric Karabell looks into the crystal ball to tell fantasy baseball managers what might come to pass in the not-too-distant future.

title: India-Pak tension: PM Modi tells top officials to remain alert, ensure essential supplies
content: Following the successful air-strikes in Pakistan, Prime Minister Modi directed key secretaries to ensure the readiness and security of essential systems. He emphasized seamless coordination among ministries for operational continuity and instructed proactive action on supply chains and infrastructure security. Departments are closely monitoring commodity prices and combating misinformation to maintain stability during potential escalations.

title: 'That's fundamentally none of our business': JD Vance on India-Pak tensions
content: US Vice President JD Vance addressed the rising tensions between India and Pakistan, stating that the conflict is "fundamentally none of our business." He acknowledged concerns about nuclear powers in conflict and emphasized the US desire for de-escalation. Vance highlighted India's grievances with Pakistan and affirmed the US will not intervene militarily, focusing instead on encouraging de-escalation.

title: Extended blackouts, curfews: Borderlands in emergency mode
content: Following strikes and counter-strikes, J&K, Punjab, Rajasthan, and Gujarat heightened border security with Pakistan, imposing blackouts and curfews. Schools and colleges shut down across J&K, while Rajasthan adjusted blackout timings and sealed its border. Punjab ordered lights out indefinitely, and drone attacks were reported and neutralized, escalating tensions and prompting safety measures.

title: India targets Lahore, Pindi, Karachi after foiling multiple Pak attacks
content: Following escalating hostilities, India retaliated against Pakistan, targeting air defense systems and other strategic sites after thwarting missile and drone attacks on Indian military bases and civilian areas. Operation Sindoor is underway, with India responding to Pakistan's aggression with targeted strikes and forward deployments. The international community watches as tensions rise between the two nations.

title: Elon Musk warns 'All life on Earth will be destroyed by...'
content: Elon Musk, SpaceX founder, warns of the sun's eventual destruction of Earth, advocating for Mars colonization as humanity's long-term survival strategy. He emphasizes the urgency of establishing a self-sustaining civilization on Mars, viewing it as "life insurance" for humanity. SpaceX is actively developing plans for Martian habitats and addressing the challenges of establishing a permanent colony.

title: 16 killed in Pak shelling, evacuation accelerated in J&K border areas
content: Pakistani forces initiated heavy mortar fire and shelling, resulting in civilian casualties in Poonch as evacuations were underway. Shelling extended to other border villages in J&K, prompting stepped-up evacuations to community bunkers and safer locations. Indian forces retaliated, and the J&K administration is coordinating evacuation efforts and emergency response for affected residents.

title: Blackouts, curfews, no leave, no lapse: Full-scale emergency mode at borders
content: Following heightened tensions, Punjab, Rajasthan, and Gujarat are fortifying their Pakistan frontier, implementing nightly blackouts, curfews, and mass leave cancellations for essential personnel. Rajasthan faces power outages and movement restrictions, while schools and universities are closed. Punjab suspends ceremonies at Wagah and prepares shelters as panic buying surges. Gujarat heightens alert in border districts after a drone sighting, initiating evacuation plans for vulnerable villages.

title: Amazon founder Jeff Bezos loses World's Second-Richest man title to...
content: Mark Zuckerberg's fortune has surged past Jeff Bezos, making him the world's second-richest person, according to the Bloomberg Billionaires Index. This shift occurred as Meta's shares outperformed Amazon's, with Meta reporting strong first-quarter revenue. Meanwhile, Elon Musk remains the wealthiest individual, boosted by increased Tesla shares following his commitment to reduce time spent on government duties.

title: 100 hardcore terrorists killed in Indian strikes: Rajnath Singh to parties
content: In response to the Pahalgam tourist massacre, India launched Operation Sindoor, neutralizing approximately 100 terrorists in strikes across Pakistan and Pakistan-occupied Kashmir, according to Defence Minister Rajnath Singh. At an all-party meeting, Singh assured that India possesses ample ammunition and is prepared to respond firmly to any Pakistani provocation. Political parties united in support of the armed forces, emphasizing national unity against terrorism.

title: Airport security at highest level: Pre-boarding checks for flyers
content: Following the closure of 27 airports in north India due to escalating tensions with Pakistan, flights are facing longer routes and potential diversions to more distant airports like Mumbai and Ahmedabad. Airlines are bypassing Pakistani airspace, causing congestion on routes via Mumbai. Indian carriers have relocated aircraft and crew from the affected airports, with IndiGo moving planes from Chandigarh.

title: Plotter of IC814 hijack, Pulwama, Pathankot killed in Bahawalpur?
content: Following India's surgical strike on Jaish-e-Muhammed's terror camp, speculation arose about the death of Abdul Rauf Asghar, brother of Jaish chief Masood Azhar. His alleged presence at a funeral, along with senior Pakistan army officers, fueled suspicions. Rauf is considered the mastermind behind several terror attacks, including the IC814 hijack and the Pulwama attack.

title: Elon Muskâ€™s X: Indian govt has asked us to block 8,000 accounts, however...
content: X (formerly Twitter) has received orders from the Indian government to block over 8,000 accounts, including those of international news organizations and prominent users, citing violations of local laws. X has complied by withholding the accounts in India but disagrees with the government's demands, viewing it as censorship and a violation of free speech.

title: In SC verdict on PC to women officers, Sofiya figured at top
content: Col Sofiya Qureshi, who recently briefed the media on India's airstrikes, was previously highlighted in a 2020 Supreme Court judgment granting permanent commission to women officers. The court, recognizing women's contributions to the armed forces, specifically mentioned Qureshi's distinguished service, including leading an Indian Army contingent at a multinational exercise and her UN peacekeeping role in Congo.

title: Village surrounded on 3 sides by Pakistan stays calm amid tensions
content: Daoke, an Amritsar village bordering Pakistan, remains cautiously calm amidst rising tensions. Villagers acknowledge the potential danger of being cut off if the connecting road is targeted, yet express trust in the Indian Army's protection. While some families have taken precautions by sending children to safer areas, daily life continues with a sense of resilience, contrasting with the palpable fear experienced during past conflicts.

title: CJI Sanjiv Khanna urges Centre to initiate steps to oust Justice Varma
content: Chief Justice Sanjiv Khanna has recommended initiating a parliamentary motion to remove Allahabad High Court's Justice Yashwant Varma after a judicial inquiry confirmed a large sum of cash was discovered at his residence. Justice Varma refused to resign, prompting the CJI to inform the President and Prime Minister, setting the stage for a potential impeachment process involving a formal inquiry and parliamentary debate.

title: Live-ins presume consent if sustained over time: Supreme Court
content: The Supreme Court has observed that a long-term live-in relationship between consenting adults implies a voluntary choice, making claims of rape based on a false promise of marriage less credible. The court emphasized the increasing financial independence of women and the prevalence of live-in relationships, urging a less rigid approach in such cases.

title: US secy speaks to Jaishankar, Pakistan PM, urges 'immediate de-escalation'
content: Amid escalating tensions, US Secretary of State Marco Rubio urged India and Pakistan to de-escalate immediately, speaking with S Jaishankar and Shehbaz Sharif. He emphasized US support for direct dialogue and asked Pakistan to end support for terrorist groups, following retaliatory air strikes and India's Operation Sindoor. Blackouts have been enforced in border regions of Jammu, Punjab and Rajasthan.

title: Right to reside in India only for citizens, Rohingya must go: Supreme Court
content: The Supreme Court declined to halt the deportation of illegal Rohingya Muslim migrants from Delhi, emphasizing that the right to reside in India is exclusive to citizens. The court acknowledged the migrants' right to life but affirmed they would be handled under the Foreigners Act. The Solicitor General assured due process while highlighting national security concerns and India's non-recognition of Rohingya refugees.

title: 1971 wasnâ€™t half as terrifying for shell-shocked Poonch
content: Poonch endured intense Pakistani bombardment, unlike anything experienced even during the 1971 war, prompting widespread fear and displacement. Shelling damaged religious sites and homes, resulting in casualties, including a tabla player, a kirtan singer and a maulvi. Residents are now fleeing, seeking safety as they express the urgent need for civilian bunkers amidst escalating tensions.

title: Tiny salutes: Newborns named â€˜Sindoorâ€™ in show of pride
content: Following India's military operation against terror camps in Pakistan, a wave of patriotic fervor has swept across the state, inspiring families to name their newborns 'Sindoor' as a tribute to the nation's resolve. This symbolic gesture reflects the pride and unity felt after 'Operation Sindoor,' launched in response to the Pahalgam terror attack.

title: Uriâ€™s 72 hours: Tuesdayâ€™s peace, Wednesdayâ€™s fire, Thursdayâ€™s ashes
content: Heavy Pakistani shelling has devastated Nowpora village in Uri, leaving residents like Tahir Talib homeless after his house was destroyed. The intense mortar fire forced families to flee, seeking refuge in Baramulla and Boniyar.  Amidst the ruins and shuttered markets, villagers return briefly to salvage belongings and protect livestock, hoping for an end to the violence that has shattered their lives.

title: Land-for-jobs case: President grants permission to prosecute Lalu
content: President Murmu has sanctioned the prosecution of Lalu Prasad in the railways jobs-for-land case, paving the way for a fast-tracked trial. The ED's chargesheets accuse Lalu and associates of accepting land as bribes for railway jobs during his tenure as minister. This sanction allows for daily hearings in a special court, expediting trials in both CBI and ED cases involving alleged corruption and money laundering.

title: Don't be surprised if the two NCP factions unite: Sharad Pawar
content: Sharad Pawar's recent hint about a potential reunion between the two NCP factions has stirred political discussions, suggesting his daughter Supriya Sule may discuss the matter with Ajit Pawar. This development introduces uncertainty for the MVA alliance, as both NCP factions show positive signs towards reconciliation. Simultaneously, speculation arises about a possible reunion between Shiv Sena (UBT) and MNS, prompting Congress to reassess its strategy for Maharashtra.

title: BCCI could opt to halt IPL 2025 keeping the nation's sentiment in mind
content: Amid escalating India-Pakistan tensions, the BCCI is contemplating halting the IPL. The DC vs PBKS match in Dharamsala was disrupted, prompting evacuation plans for players and staff. Overseas players are anxious, awaiting assurances from the BCCI and the government. The IPL Governing Council is meeting to decide the tournament's future, guided by government directives, while teams adjust travel plans.

title: Chhota Rajan granted bail in 2009 attempt to murder case
content: A special CBI court granted bail to gangster Chhota Rajan in a 2009 attempt to murder case, noting that all accused, including Surendrakumar Agrawal, have been on bail since the beginning. Despite the bail in this case, Rajan will remain in jail as he is serving a life sentence for the 2011 murder of journalist J Dey.

title: Govt sets record foodgrain target of 354 MT on 'good monsoon' forecast
content: Buoyed by forecasts of a favorable monsoon, the government has set an ambitious foodgrain production target of 354 million tonnes for the 2025-26 crop year. This target, nearly 4% higher than the previous year, aims to capitalize on expected good rainfall. A nationwide awareness campaign will educate farmers on climate-resilient seeds and government programs.

title: Mehbooba asks PM to pick dialogue with Pak over hostilities, cites deaths on either side
content: PDP chief Mehbooba Mufti urged PM Modi to prioritize dialogue with Pakistan following the Pahalgam terrorist attack, cautioning against military escalation. She highlighted the human cost of conflict, sharing images of children killed in shelling and advocating for peaceful co-existence. PDP legislator Waheed Para echoed this sentiment, emphasizing that J&K bears the brunt of India-Pakistan hostilities and stressing the need for dialogue.

title: 11 years on, Maharashtra official convicted of taking Rs 1,500 bribe
content: The Anti-Corruption Bureau (ACB), facing criticism for low conviction rates, successfully convicted a retired senior transport official in an 11-year-old bribery case. Rajendra Aknath Nerkar, along with an accomplice, was sentenced for accepting a bribe to return bus documents. This conviction highlights ACB's commitment to prosecuting high-ranking officials despite past challenges with evidence and witness availability.

title: Three held in Meerut for 'pro-Pakistan posts'
content: In Meerut, tensions flared as three individuals were arrested for allegedly sharing objectionable pro-Pakistan content on social media platforms. Authorities heightened online surveillance amid ongoing Indo-Pak tensions, leading to arrests based on WhatsApp posts and Instagram remarks. One incident involved an assault on an activist who reported the pro-Pakistan remarks, prompting police to register a case and arrest the accused and a salon owner.

title: Indus Waters Treaty a â€˜historic mistakeâ€™, says Shivraj Singh Chouhan
content: Union Agriculture Minister Shivraj Singh Chouhan criticized the 1960 Indus Water Treaty as a "historic mistake," asserting the government's commitment to utilizing water allocated to Pakistan for irrigation and hydropower projects. Following a terror attack in J&K, the treaty has been kept in abeyance, potentially benefiting farmers in bordering states with increased water access.

title: Cash-for-jobs: SC asks WB government to decide on prosecution sanction
content: The Supreme Court has directed the West Bengal government to decide on granting prosecution sanction against co-accused individuals in the cash-for-jobs case involving former minister Partha Chatterjee within two weeks. This order was issued during the hearing of Chatterjee's bail plea, where his lawyer cited the lack of sanction against co-accused as a cause for trial delay.

title: In sealed cover, WB governor lists reasons for not agreeing to 17 VC picks
content: West Bengal Governor C V Anand Bose submitted to the Supreme Court the reasons for rejecting the state government's recommendations for vice-chancellors in 17 universities, while approving appointments for 19 others. The court, noting former CJI U U Lalit's involvement in the initial shortlist, has requested him to review the Governor's objections. The matter is adjourned for further hearing.

title: SC slams â€˜irresponsibleâ€™ Dubey, but spares him from contempt
content: The Supreme Court rebuked BJP MP Nishikant Dubey for his "irresponsible, absurd and scandalous" allegations against the CJI-led bench regarding petitions challenging the Wakf Amendment Act. While the court declined to initiate contempt proceedings, citing its resilience against ludicrous statements, it firmly asserted that any attempt to spread communal hatred or indulge in hate speech must be dealt with an iron hand.

title: 14th night of Pakistan truce violation, toll rises to 16
content: Pakistan's continuous shelling across the LoC after India's response to a terrorist attack resulted in more casualties. The death toll has risen to 16 in just over 48 hours. Mortar and heavy artillery fire targeted several sectors, marking the 14th consecutive night of truce violations. Many people were wounded. The Jammu and Kashmir government ordered the closure of educational institutions in five border districts.

title: Three Greyhounds cops killed in Maoist landmine blast
content: In a tragic ambush near the Telangana-Chhattisgarh border, three Greyhounds commandos were killed and another critically injured by Maoist landmine blast. The attack occurred during a counter-insurgency operation in the Wazeedu-Perur forest region, marking the first police casualties in anti-Maoist operations in the state this year. Authorities have launched a manhunt for the Maoist cadres responsible.

title: If judges not shielded, they may seek political patronage: Ex-CJI
content: CJI-designate B R Gavai, poised to become the 52nd CJI, pledged leadership and a long-term vision for the judiciary, echoing former CJI N V Ramana's sentiments. Speaking at the release of Justice Ramana's book, Justice Gavai assured that he would follow Ramana's guidance. Justice Ramana emphasized the moral duty of the CJI and SC judges to support all judges, ensuring they feel secure and protected.

title: 4 Chinese held for entering India sans visa through Bihar
content: Four Chinese nationals were apprehended by Sashastra Seema Bal (SSB) for illegally entering India from Nepal through Raxaul without valid visas. Interrogation revealed they intended to return to Hathaura and Lumbini in Nepal. Investigation agencies, including NIA and IB, are struggling to determine the exact purpose of their visit due to a language barrier, as the individuals primarily respond in Chinese.

title: Six die as chopper with Char Dham pilgrims crashes near Gangotri
content: A helicopter carrying pilgrims to the Gangotri shrine crashed near Uttarkashi, claiming six lives, including five pilgrims and the pilot. The accident occurred when the chopper veered off course and lost altitude, plunging into a gorge. One passenger survived and is critically injured. Authorities have launched an investigation to determine the cause of the crash, raising concerns about helicopter travel safety in the Himalayas during peak pilgrimage season.

title: False charge: Chennai bus conductor wins 5-year-long legal battle
content: A Metropolitan Transport Corporation (MTC) conductor, K Radhakrishnan, faced a false misconduct charge after a passenger mistakenly picked up a soiled ticket. This led to illegal salary recovery and a five-year legal battle. The Madras High Court intervened, ordering MTC to refund the recovered amount of Rs 25,200 with 6% interest and settle all pending retirement dues, highlighting the injustice he suffered.

title: Toll mounts to 9 in LPG cylinder blast at Bikaner jewellery complex
content: A devastating LPG cylinder explosion in Bikaner's Madan Market commercial complex resulted in nine fatalities, with rescue teams uncovering additional bodies from the collapsed basement floors. The blast, initially mistaken for an airstrike, exposed unauthorized jewellery manufacturing units operating in the basement. Authorities are investigating illegal operations and safety violations, prompting a broader inquiry and sealing of several shops.

title: Led by minister, AAP workers lock up BBMB chairman
content: Following a High Court order, tensions escalated at the Nangal dam as AAP workers, led by a minister, briefly detained the BBMB chief to prevent water release to Haryana. Punjab's CM accused the chairman of illegally diverting water and stated the diverted water has been restored to Punjab. The High Court has directed the Centre to provide details of the meeting regarding the water release and clarify dispute resolution mechanisms.

title: After 18 yrs, identical twins who used the same papers to get jobs caught
content: In Madhya Pradesh's Damoh district, a massive education fraud has been unearthed, revealing how teachers secured jobs using fake documents. Twin sisters, both named Rashmi, fraudulently worked for 18 years, costing the state over Rs 1.6 crore. Despite a High Court order, 16 teachers with confirmed irregularities remain employed, having collectively drawn nearly Rs 22.9 crore in salaries.

title: Rain and landslides shut Jammu-Srinagar highway
content: The Srinagar-Jammu National Highway, a crucial link between Kashmir and the rest of India, was shut down on Thursday due to rain-induced mudslides in Ramban. Hundreds of vehicles were stranded as landslides and shooting stones blocked the road. The India Meteorological Department has issued a yellow alert for more rain in the region.

title: Robert Francis Prevost Is New Pope, Takes Papal Name Pope Leon XIV
content: Cardinal Robert Prevost, a long-time missionary in Latin America, was elected as the surprise choice to be the new leader of the Catholic Church on Thursday, becoming the first U.S. pope and taking the name Leo XIV.

title: Operation Sindoor Live Updates: Infiltration Bid Stopped In J&K, Naval Ops Begin After Pak Strikes
content: Operation Sindoor Live Updates: India thwarted Pakistan's attempts at targeting 15 places in the country amid rising tension between the two countries, a fallout of the terror attack in Jammu and Kashmir's Pathankot on April 22 that killed 26 people.

title: "Fundamentally None Of Our Business": JD Vance On India-Pak Conflict
content: US Vice-President J.D. Vance has said that the conflict between India and Pakistan is "fundamentally none of our business," though he and President Donald Trump are encouraging both the countries to de-escalate.

title: No Beating Retreat Ceremonies At Attari, Hussainiwala, Sadqi Posts Along Pak Border: BSF
content: The Border Security Force (BSF) has stopped the Beating Retreat ceremonies at all three border check posts along Pakistan in Punjab-- Attari-Wagah, Hussainwala, and Sadki-- till further orders in view of public safety.

title: Trump Calls For 30-Day Russia-Ukraine Ceasefire
content: U.S. President Donald Trump called on Thursday for a 30-day unconditional ceasefire between Russia and Ukraine and said that both countries will be held accountable for the "sanctity of these direct negotiations."

title: Amit Shah Speaks To Chiefs Of Border Guarding Forces As Tensions Rise
content: Amid the escalating tensions between India and Pakistan, Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Thursday spoke with the Director Generals of border guarding forces to assess the situation.

title: India Foils Pakistani Attack On Military Bases, Blackouts In Border Areas
content: Pakistan, hours after its foiled attempt to target 15 Indian cities, launched an attack on parts of Jammu and Kashmir. While the border areas are under heavy shelling,  Jammu is being targeted with missiles and drones.

title: Infiltration Bid Foiled In J&K's Samba Amid Surging India-Pak Tensions
content: The Border Security Force said it foiled an infiltration bid in Jammu and Kashmir's Samba along the international border with Pakistan this evening amid massive drone and missile attacks from Pakistan.

title: Pakistan F-16 Shot Down By Indian Surface-To-Air Missile: Sources
content: An F-16 supersonic fighter jet of the Pakistan Air Force was shot down in the evening by an Indian surface-to-air missile defence system, sources told NDTV.

title: Explained: Details Of The US-UK Economic Deal
content: The United States and Britain announced a deal to lower tariffs on some goods on Thursday, with U.S. levies on cars and steel being cut and both sides gaining better access to agriculture markets.

title: Government Busts Fake News About Airport Entry Ban Amid India-Pak Tensions
content: The Fact Check unit of the Press Information Bureau (PIB) has clarified that claims on social media about a ban on entry to airports across India are false.

title: Operation Sindoor Live Updates:  "Operations Remain Normal," Says Delhi Airport
content: Operation Sindoor Live Updates: The Indian armed forces foiled fresh attempts by the Pakistani military to target northern and western cities using drones and missiles on Thursday evening, sources said.

title: Punjab Shuts All Education Institutes For 3 Days, Cancels Leaves Of Police
content: The Punjab government on Thursday ordered the closure of all educational institutions for the next three days and cancelled the leaves of all police personnel amid escalating tensions along the India-Pakistan border.

title: Power Restored In Chandigarh Hours After Sirens Sounded, Blackout
content: Amid a missile and drone attack by Pakistan in parts of Jammu and Kashmir and shelling in Punjab's Pathankot, sirens have been sounded in Chandigarh and a blackout has been enforced. Shops have been asked to close and people have been asked to go hom

title: Delhi On High Alert, Government Employees' Leave Cancelled Amid India-Pak Tensions
content: A high alert was sounded in Delhi, and all city government employees' leaves were cancelled as hostilities ramped up between India and Pakistan, with several border areas, including Jammu, coming under cross-border shelling.

title: "Pahalgam Attack Was Original Escalation": India On 'Op Sindoor' Response
content: The attack in Kashmir's Pahalgam on April 22 was the "original escalation", Foreign Secretary Vikram Misri said on Thursday as he gave details about India's 'Operation Sindoor'.

title: India Likely To Urge IMF To Exercise Caution On Bailout Package To Pakistan
content: A day ahead of a crucial meeting of the International Monetary Fund (IMF) in Washington, India on Thursday hinted that it could communicate its view to the global financial body on its bailout package for Pakistan.

title: All You Need To Know About Robert Francis Prevost: First Pope From US
content: Robert Francis Prevost, the first pope from the United States, has a history of missionary work in Peru but also a keen grasp of the inner workings of the Church.

title: Airlines Ask Passengers To Arrive 3 Hours Before Flight Amid India-Pak Tension
content: Several airlines, including Air India, IndiGo and SpiceJet, advised passengers to arrive at their respective airports at least three hours before scheduled departure on Thursday amid rising India-Pak tensions.

title: Under Heavy Shelling From Pakistan, J&K's Rajouri Refuses To Bow Down
content: Rajouri, once a well-known pit-stop in Buddhist journeys and mentioned in ancient texts, is now a district where families shelter behind faith and sandbags.

title: The ultimate guide to your draft
content: AndrÃ© Snellings provides a blueprint to follow for fantasy women's basketball drafts including his ideal selections in each round.

title: ClÃ¡sico kits: Barcelona, Real Madrid's all-time best, worst jerseys
content: El ClÃ¡sico is a clash of two of the world's most recognizable teams, Barcelona and Real Madrid. Both have iconic kits and shocking shirts in their closets.

title: Ancelotti's Real Madrid limbo explained: Why he could leave, and what comes next
content: As Carlo Ancelotti prepares for what appears to be his final ClÃ¡sico, how could his last few weeks play out?

title: Transfer rumors, news: Napoli aim to beat Liverpool to De Bruyne
content: Napoli will make a concrete attempt to sign Kevin De Bruyne in the coming weeks. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Pocso Act not meant to criminalise adolescents' consensual relations: Allahabad HC

title: Enter Sandman: Metallica brings seismic shift to Virginia Tech stadium
content: over 60,000 fans gathered at Virginia Tech's Lane Stadium for a night that created ground tremors . the iconic metal band finally brought their song "Enter Sandman" in front of this dedicated fan base . it was so well-received that it brought a seismic shift to the stadium .

title: Panthers cut Clowney; RB Brooks out for season
content: the Carolina Panthers are moving on from three-time pro Bowl edge rusher Jadeveon Clowney . it was one of several moves announced by the Panthers before the start of their rookie minicamp . he will miss the entire 2025 season as he recovers from his second injury to his right knee .

title: How 48 hours recalibrated Draymond Green -- and how it's already impacting Round 2
content: steph Curry's left hamstring injury gave the Golden State Warriors a 30-20 lead . he drilled another 3 from the top of the key, giving the Timberwolves a timeout . "i'll be back," Curry told Green as the point guard walked gingerly toward the tunnel .

title: 'Annoyed' Arteta says best team in UCL 'are out'
content: alejandro Moreno slams arsenal for their dependence on set pieces after their exit . the gunners won 2-1 on goals from FabiÃ¡n Ruiz and Achraf Hakimi to complete a 3-1 aggregate victory . a 69th-minute penalty for a handball by myles Lewis-Skelly was awarded on VAR review .

title: India shoots down at least 2 Pakistan fighter jets: Report
content: the TOI News Desk comprises a dedicated and tireless team of journalists who operate around the clock to deliver the most current and comprehensive news and updates to the readers of The Times of India worldwide . the team is at the forefront of gathering, verifying, and presenting breaking news, in-depth analysis, and insightful reports on a wide range of topics .

title: Ranking the top 25 WNBA players: Wilson No. 1, but where do Collier, Stewart, Clark land?
content: the 2025 WNBA season is here, with preseason games underway and the regular season set to tip May 16 . a'ja Wilson and the Las Vegas Aces have a bit of a new look but remain confident in their core . caitlin Clark is looking to lead the Indiana Fever into title contention .

title: Expert picks, best bets: What's Della Maddalena's path to a title win?
content: welterweight champion belal Muhammad is ranked no. 10 on ESPN's pound-for-pound list . he is unbeaten inside the Octagon, reeling off seven consecutive wins . women's flyweight champion Valentina Shevchenko puts her belt on the line against manon Fiorot .

title: Missing stars and missed 3s: Why the Cavs and Celtics are suddenly in massive holes
content: the Cleveland Cavaliers and Boston Celtics each won 60-plus games . there's no precedent in league history for what we saw in the opening days of the conference semifinals . a week ago, the playoffs ended with a 2-0 lead over the san francisco pacers .

title: Arsenal can't shake nearly-men tag as PSG's collective wins out
content: Paris Saint-Germain will face internazionale in the UEFA champions league final on may 31 . fabiÃ¡n Ruiz's first-half goal and Achraf Hakimi's strike in the second half put PSG on course for the final in Munich . Bukayo Saka 's 76th-minute goal gave the Gunners hope of a late comeback .
